title: A childhood snatched, a future denied in Telangana and A.P.

title: Mother cannot seek cancellation of gift deed executed by father or vice-versa, rules Madras High Court
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh also holds that gift deeds cannot be cancelled if they do not explicitly impose a condition to take care of the aged parents

title: â€˜Keep my bag or Iâ€™ll crash planeâ€™: AI flight delayed as doc threatens crew
content: An Ayurvedic doctor, Vyas Hiral Mohanbhai, was arrested in Bengaluru after causing a disturbance on an Air India flight to Surat. She allegedly threatened to crash the aircraft when crew members objected to her placing baggage in a restricted area. Mohanbhai bypassed check-in, insisting on carrying both bags onboard, leading to a two-hour flight delay and a security concern.

title: Family feud: Dayanidhi Maran accuses brother Kalanithi of fraud; sends legal notice
content: Dayanidhi Maran has accused his brother Kalanithi Maran of illegally transferring Sun TV group shares worth thousands of crore. The legal notice alleges Kalanithi amassed Rs 5,926 crore in dividends until 2023 and Rs 455 crore in 2024 through fraudulent means. Dayanidhi threatens legal action, demanding the restoration of the company's original ownership structure from 2003.

title: Israel-Iran war: Trump weighs US strike; Netanyahu cites 'personal cost' - 10 key points
content: Tensions soar between Israel and Iran following Israeli airstrikes and Iranian retaliation, raising fears of regional escalation. President Trump will decide on US military intervention within two weeks, hinging on nuclear negotiations. Israel's Defence Minister threatened Iran's Supreme Leader, while satellite images reveal US military aircraft repositioning.

title: Shocker! Aus drop star batter after WTC final defeat against SA
content: Australia have dropped Marnus Labuschagne for the first Test against the West Indies, as announced by selector George Bailey. Steve Smith will also miss the match due to a finger injury sustained during the World Test Championship final. Labuschagne's recent form has been poor, averaging 24.7 in his last 16 matches.

title: Amazon's ultimatum: Company tells employees to choose - 30 days to ... or resign in 60 days
content: Amazon is requiring numerous corporate employees to relocate to major hubs like Seattle and Arlington, creating anxiety amidst job insecurity and AI-driven workforce reductions. Affected employees face short deadlines to decide, with no severance offered for those who resign instead of moving. This relocation push intensifies Amazon's in-office requirements and aligns with warnings of upcoming AI-related layoffs.

title: Cash-at-home case: Probe panel junks theories offered by Varma in his defence; what report said
content: An inquiry committee has rejected Justice Varma's explanations regarding the cash found at his residence, dismissing claims of planted evidence and arson. The panel's report highlighted Varma's control over the premises and questioned his conduct following the discovery. Evidence and witness statements suggest a breach of public trust, potentially leading to removal proceedings.

title: Messi does it again! Inter Miami make history in Club World Cup - Watch
content: Inter Miami, co-owned by David Beckham, achieved a stunning 2-1 victory over Porto in the Club World Cup, fueled by Lionel Messi's exceptional free-kick. After Porto's early lead, Segovia equalised before Messi's decisive goal. This win marks a historic moment as the first MLS team to defeat European opposition in competitive play.

title: 'Selectors shouldn't repeat the mistake': Kaif warns Gambhir
content: As India prepares for the first Test against England, the crucial No. 3 position is under scrutiny with Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma absent. Sai Sudharsan's IPL form puts him in contention, but Abhimanyu Easwaran's extensive domestic record presents a strong case. Mohammad Kaif urges selectors to respect Easwaran's experience, cautioning against overlooking proven performers like Sarfaraz Khan.

title: AI is your intern today: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman to software engineers; but soon â€¦
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman envisions AI evolving from an 'intern' to a seasoned software engineer, potentially revolutionizing coding roles. He anticipates AI agents tackling complex business problems and discovering new knowledge soon. While this shift demands software engineers focus on AI management and innovation, concerns arise about AI's impact on employment, with predictions of significant job displacement in white-collar sectors.

title: Shukla's Axiom 4 launch delayed again; Nasa cites safety checks; new date soon
content: Nasa has delayed the Axiom Mission 4 launch to the ISS, which includes Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla, due to the need for further assessment of recent repairs on the Zvezda service module. Engineers are ensuring the space station is fully prepared to support the new crew, which also includes astronauts from Poland and Hungary.

title: Exclusive | If Bumrah is even 75â€“80% fit, Iâ€™d ...: Ex-England captain Gower
content: David Gower discusses the upcoming England-India Test series, highlighting Shubman Gill's captaincy challenges and Jasprit Bumrah's crucial role. Gower emphasizes the importance of Bumrah's strategic deployment due to workload management. He acknowledges India's transition period with experienced players like KL Rahul stepping up, while favoring England to win the series 3-1 due to home advantage and India's vulnerabilities.

title: PM Modi to visit Bihar, Odisha, and Andhra Pradesh- What's on his agenda?
content: Prime Minister Modi is embarking on a two-day tour across Bihar, Odisha, and Visakhapatnam, commencing Friday. He will inaugurate development projects, including railway lines and sewage treatment plants, and launch new train services. In Odisha, projects worth over Rs 18,600 crore will be initiated.

title: Narayana Murthy on future of Indiaâ€™s tech talent; says our programmers will â€¦
content: nfosys founder NR Narayana Murthy dismisses AI job elimination fears, arguing technology creates new employment opportunities. Citing banking sector's 40-50x job growth post-computerization, he believes AI will enhance productivity and enable programmers to solve complex problems, transforming rather than replacing the workforce in India's IT industry.

title: Amid escalating conflict, India to extend Op Sindhu to Israel as well
content: Amid escalating tensions between Israel and Iran, the Indian government has initiated evacuation plans for Indian nationals in Israel, facilitating their departure via land borders followed by air travel to India. Simultaneously, 'Operation Sindhu' is underway to evacuate Indians from Iran, with a special flight already bringing 110 students back from Urmia Medical University.

title: IND vs ENG: For Shubman Gill the captain to thrive, the batter must fire
content: On the eve of his first Test as India captain, Shubman Gill immersed himself in a marathon net session at Headingley, showcasing sharp focus on his batting. Now slotted at No. 4, Gill aims to assert himself as a dependable run-scorer in the post-Kohli era. While captaincy talk dominates, Gill remains clear: batting form is key to leading well.

title: Brandon Aiyuk sends clear message to San Francisco 49ers
content: Kansas City Chiefs may target Brandon Aiyuk before the 2025 season. Aiyuk seeks a long-term deal, around $23 million annually. This move could boost the Chiefs' offense and aid Patrick Mahomes. Aiyuk hinted at leaving the 49ers. Experts suggest the Chiefs will pursue Aiyuk if he is available. Mahomes has been training with young receivers.

title: Trump hosts Juventus: Poses awkward question; GM answers diplomatically
content: Juventus squad visited the White House before their FIFA Club World Cup game. Donald Trump's unexpected question about women joining the team stunned the players. Juventus General Manager responded diplomatically. Despite the awkward moment, Juventus defeated Al Ain 5â€“0 in their first match. Randal Kolo Muani and Francisco ConceiÃ§Ã£o scored twice. The team will face Wydad AC next.

title: Dwyane Wade's wife Gabrielle Union shows support for Victoria MonÃ©t in heartfelt post
content: Gabrielle Union is set to moderate Victoria MonÃ©t's book launch event in Los Angeles for her new children's book, 'Everywhere You Are.' Union reposted MonÃ©t's announcement on Instagram, expressing her support for the book, which explores themes of love and connection. The event promises a discussion and Q&A session, with both mothers and authors sharing their insights.

title: Wayne Gretzky opens up about how his father tried to stop nickname from sticking
content: Wayne Gretzky's iconic nickname, 'The Great One,' faced initial resistance from his father, Walter. Despite concerns about pressure, the name stuck as Gretzky dominated youth hockey. He later embraced it, exceeding expectations with a record-breaking NHL career. Gretzky also commented on the Edmonton Oilers' recent loss to the Florida Panthers. His journey reflects humility, brilliance, and lasting greatness in hockey.

title: Shashi Tharoor admits differences with party brass, but refuses to discuss them in public
content: Shashi Tharoor, a Congress MP, has publicly acknowledged disagreements with certain party leaders, refraining from elaborating due to the Nilambur bypoll. This admission follows his praise for the NDA government's Operation Sindoor and participation in an all-party delegation against terror, reportedly causing discomfort within the Congress leadership.

title: India bleeds Pak dry: Water at â€˜deadâ€™ levels; bigger Indus plans - top points
content: Following the Indus Waters Treaty suspension, India is optimizing the Indus river system, looking to construct a 113-km canal to redirect water to Punjab, Haryana, and Rajasthan. This inter-basin transfer aims to maximize water usage from eastern rivers and fully utilize India's share of western rivers, potentially limiting Pakistan's water access.

title: Will the US join Israel's strike on Iran? Here's what White House answered
content: President Trump will decide within two weeks whether the US will join Israel's military actions against Iran, amidst ongoing speculation. He acknowledged a 'substantial' chance for negotiations to peacefully resolve the conflict. This declaration offers a diplomatic window, despite Trump's earlier strong statements.

title: Akshay Kumar's â€˜Housefull 5â€™ slows down as â€˜Sitare Zameen Parâ€™ hits cinemas
content: Akshay Kumar's Housefull 5, after a strong start, is seeing a slowdown in its third week. The comedy film has earned Rs 167.90 crore in India so far. Aamir Khan's Sitare Zameen Par released on June 20. The film has promising advance bookings, earning Rs 3.31 crore already. Sitare Zameen Par's release could impact Housefull 5's box office performance.

title: Trump-Munir meeting signals strategic calculations amid regional tensions
content: A White House meeting between President Trump and Field Marshal Asim Munir has ignited speculation about a potential US-Pakistan realignment. Discussions centered on counter-terrorism, trade, and regional stability, with Trump reportedly seeking Pakistan's assistance regarding Iran in exchange for economic and military support. This move could reshape South Asia's power dynamics, impacting India's regional influence.

title: Post stampede, Karnataka drafts tough crowd-control bill
content: Following a tragic stampede during IPL victory celebrations, the Karnataka government has drafted a bill to hold event organizers accountable for crowd management. The proposed legislation includes jail time and fines for safety violations, granting authorities broad powers to regulate events.

title: Mehul Choksi sues India in UK high court for â€˜kidnapping himâ€™ in Antigua
content: Mehul Choksi is suing the Indian government and five individuals in London's High Court, alleging his kidnapping from Antigua in 2021 was orchestrated by India's intelligence agency, R&AW, as part of a honeytrap plot to extradite him.

title: Telangana village on 'suicide watch' saves 300 lives in 3 years
content: Residents of Yamcha, a village near Nizamabad, Telangana, have bravely prevented over 300 suicide attempts in the past three years, primarily at the Basara bridge, a known suicide hotspot. The villagers, skilled swimmers, vigilantly monitor the river, especially during the monsoon, rescuing individuals driven to desperation by debt and family issues.

title: Uddhav already politically dead, declares Shinde
content: At Shiv Sena's foundation day event, Eknath Shinde attacked Uddhav Thackeray for alleged BMC corruption and abandoning Bal Thackeray's ideology. Shinde questioned Thackeray's actions regarding Marathi people in Mumbai, accusing him of prioritizing money over their welfare.

title: Crashed plane was 'well-maintained', says Air India CEO
content: A well-maintained Air India Boeing 787 Dreamliner (VT-ANB) crashed in Ahmedabad last Thursday, killing 241 onboard and 34 on the ground. Despite regular monitoring and recent engine overhauls, the cause remains unknown. Air India MD & CEO Campbell Wilson expressed sorrow and commitment to supporting families and investigations.

title: Scores of Indians stranded in Iran, Israel; anxiety stalks kin
content: Amid escalating conflict between Iran and Israel, numerous Indian nationals, including students and pilgrims, are stranded, facing uncertain and risky returns. Indian embassies are coordinating evacuations, yet communication with some individuals remains difficult, causing immense distress to families back in India. Efforts are underway to provide assistance and facilitate their safe passage through neighboring countries.

title: Railways caps wait-list tickets at 25% of train's capacity
content: Indian Railways has initiated a policy shift by capping wait-listed tickets to a maximum of 25% of available berths in each class, aiming to reduce passenger uncertainty and overcrowding. This decision, implemented following a Railway Board circular, allows zonal railways to determine waitlist limits based on booking and cancellation patterns.

title: Gisele Bundchen gives Tom Brady a cold, silent Fatherâ€™s Day
content: Tom Brady publicly acknowledged Gisele BÃ¼ndchen on Mother's Day, praising her dedication to their children. However, BÃ¼ndchen's silence on Father's Day sparked speculation, contrasting with Brady's tribute to his own father. This disparity fueled discussions about their post-divorce relationship, especially as BÃ¼ndchen embraces her new life with Joaquim Valente, while Brady continues to emphasize family values.

title: Day after rapping Tamil Nadu, SC says ADGP's suspension is in order
content: The Supreme Court has acknowledged the Tamil Nadu government's authority to suspend ADGP H M Jayaram, who is under investigation for an alleged kidnapping. The suspension aligns with All-India Service Rules, as clarified by senior advocate Siddharth Dave.

title: Court rejects Navlakha's plea, says he can't permanently stay in Delhi
content: A special NIA court has denied Gautam Navlakha's request to permanently reside in Delhi, citing jurisdictional constraints imposed by the Bombay High Court. Navlakha, an accused in the Elgar Parishad case, argued financial strain and his sister's health as reasons to relocate. The court emphasized that residing outside its jurisdiction differs from traveling beyond it, upholding the bail conditions.

title: No SC order on vigilantes, it says state to act against violent acts
content: The Supreme Court declined to issue guidelines or penalties against a vigilante group threatening the release of 'Thug Life' in Karnataka, emphasizing the state's responsibility to prevent violence. Despite initial protests over Kamal Haasan's remarks, the film's producer expressed satisfaction with the state's assurance of maintaining order, leading to the dismissal of the petition.

title: A decade after Act was enacted, Lokpal notifies constitution of prosecution wing
content: Over a decade after its enactment, the Lokpal, India's anti-corruption ombudsman, has established its prosecution wing. Mandated to investigate graft allegations against public officials, this move fulfills Section 12 of the Lokpal and Lokayuktas Act, 2013.

title: Honoured to meet Pak army chief Asim Munir, says Trump after their discussion
content: President Trump walked back on his claims of brokering an India-Pakistan ceasefire after meeting with Pakistan's army chief, Field Marshal Asim Munir. Trump lauded the two nations' leaders for averting a potential nuclear conflict. Discussions also involved a potential US-Pakistan trade partnership and the Iran-Israel situation, with Trump seeking Pakistan's insights on Iran.

title: SC put stop to 'bulldozer justice': Executive can't be judge, jury, says CJI
content: Chief Justice of India, B R Gavai, addressing Italian judges, highlighted the Supreme Court's role in promoting socio-economic justice over the past 75 years. He cited the SC's ban on "bulldozer justice," preventing arbitrary demolition of homes and upholding citizens' right to shelter.

title: Cash-at-home case: Liquor fuelled fire at judge's house that burnt cash, says report
content: A high-level judicial panel's inquiry revealed a fire at Justice Yashwant Varma's residence on March 14 uncovered burnt, unexplained cash. Firefighters reported the blaze intensified due to alcohol from a liquor cabinet near the storeroom, where currency notes were visible amidst the debris. Justice Varma was away, and the room had to be forcibly opened, according to the report.

title: Airport lounge experience set for a change
content: To enhance the airport lounge experience, operators and banks are planning direct business, bypassing aggregators. A dedicated app will allow flyers to book lounge access in advance and swipe their cards at the gate. This initiative aims to improve the lounge experience for premium credit cardholders and full-service airline passengers, addressing current issues like long queues and undifferentiated service.

title: Canada intel: pro-Khalistan extremist using our soil as base to target India
content: A Canadian intelligence report acknowledges the presence of Khalistani extremists in Canada, using the country for promotion, fundraising, and planning violence in India. Tensions between Canada and India remain strained following the killing of Hardeep Singh Nijjar, with investigations suggesting Indian government links. The report also highlights concerns about India's foreign interference activities in Canada.

title: 19-yr-old runner dies after cardiac arrest
content: Bhupendra Devli, a 19-year-old long-distance runner, tragically died of a cardiac arrest while training for a marathon near Bhowali Road in Nainital. He collapsed while running with a friend and was rushed to the hospital, but was declared dead on arrival. Initial post-mortem reports suggest a massive cardiac arrest, possibly worsened by delayed medical intervention, was the cause of death.

title: LLM degree holder fails bar test, HC sends notice to BCI
content: The Gujarat High Court has issued a notice to the Bar Council of India (BCI) following a petition by Urvi Acharya, an LLM graduate, who failed the All India Bar Examination (AIBE) despite its open-book format. Acharya alleges a lack of transparency, as the BCI provided no justification for her failure, even after re-checking.

title: Privacy is a fundamental right but is subject to reasonable curbs: High Court
content: Madhya Pradesh High Court has ruled that WhatsApp chats are admissible as evidence in matrimonial disputes, even if obtained without consent. The court emphasized that while the right to privacy is fundamental, it is not absolute and can be reasonably restricted.

title: PLL Power Rankings ahead of Week 4: Who's the new No. 1?
content: four teams are 2-1, while the other four are 1-2 . the redwoods jump into a top spot after a 12-11 win over California last week . but the team is winning just 38% of their faceoffs and their offense isn't humming .

title: Why the Panthers are the nicest 'rats' to win the Stanley Cup (twice)
content: the Florida Panthers defeat the Edmonton Oilers 5-1 to become back-to-back Stanley Cup champions . they're the most antagonistic trash-talking bullies in the national hockey league . opponents decry their actions and fans outright loathe them .

title: Ranking the 10 most unbreakable records in college football
content: college football has evolved greatly over the years, but there are some records and accomplishments that have stood the test of time . we've examined the past 75 years in college football, tracing back to the 1950 season, and have ranked the 10 most "unbreakable" records in the sport, listing them in order of least likely to be topped.

title: NFL execs, scouts pick their favorite offseason moves: Where Rodgers, Pickens rate
content: twenty-eight teams are officially off for the summer, with the frenzied nature of transactions fading into the background . this week's minicamp is the ideal time to take stock of the splash moves around the league . a few potential moves remain on the radar, including a potential Jalen Ramsey trade .

title: Euro 2025 team-by-team preview, predictions, key players, more
content: 16 nations will compete at euro 2025 in Switzerland for the chance to be crowned european champions . the stakes are higher than ever, with prize money more than doubled compared with the previous tournament . each federation receives at least â‚¬1.8 million and required to allocate at least 30% to players .

title: Is the Club World Cup important? Yes, just ask the South American teams
content: Boca Juniors fans get ready for the club world cup with chants and drums on Miami beach . the tournament feels unmistakably South American, but in the u.s. it's a global tournament . many of their UEFA counterparts shrug with apathy at the expanded tournament, noting its lack of history .

title: Who has the best lineup in MLB? We ranked all 30 teams
content: a panel of our MLB experts ranks every team based on a combination of what we've seen so far and what we knew going into the season . the latest offensive shake-up came in the form of a blockbuster trade, with the Red Sox sending all-Star slugger Rafael Devers to the Giants .

title: Five takeaways from J.J. McCarthy's offseason as Vikings' expected starting QB
content: the world has no shortage of opinions on quarterback J.J. McCarthy . he's not ready to lead the Vikings to super bowl lX in february . "they've really pushed the limits on just what I can handle," he says .

title: MbappÃ© out of hospital after gastroenteritis issue
content: real madrid's Kylian MbappÃ© discharged from hospital after his club said he had been admitted and was undergoing treatment for acute gastroenteritis . the star forward missed the club's 1-1 draw with al-Hilal on Wednesday . he has not trained in recent days and will continue with specific medical treatment .
